Discription.d1: + The Phase-locked loop (PLL) is used to generate stable and accurate frequencies and also stable signals.
Discription.d2: + Blocks that make up this PLL are the phase frequency detector (PFD), Charge Pump (CP), loop filter, ring oscillator, and frequency divider.
Discription.d3: + Implement a simple DFF+AND-based PFD for minimum complexity and minimum power consumption. Two TSPC (True Single-Phase Clocking) D-FF are used, and a symmetric NAND along with a NOT gate is used as feedback.
Discription.d4: + The three states of the PFD are used to regulate a charge pump, which is an electronic switch with three positions. The switch sends a current to the loop filter as a control signal.
Discription.d5: + A loop filter converts the pulsating DC output of the CP to a smooth control voltage that can be fed to the oscillator.
Discription.d6: + A frequency divider divides the input frequency by N based on the number of stages..
